title: How to Charge an AirPod Case Wirelessly or with a Cable

steps.title: Place your AirPods into the charging case (optional).
steps.content: Place your AirPods into the charging case (optional). [1] X Research source If your AirPods donâ€™t need to charge, you can charge the case on its own. While the case is charging, you can take the chance to clean the AirPods , or you can use the AirPods normally.

steps.title: Close the AirPod case.
steps.content: Close the AirPod case. You won't be able to charge it if it's left open. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Plug a Lightning connector into the bottom of the case.
steps.content: Plug a Lightning connector into the bottom of the case. Use the Lightning cable that came with your AirPods. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Plug the USB connector into a USB port or charger.
steps.content: Plug the USB connector into a USB port or charger. For fastest results, use an iPhone or iPad USB charging block. There is a status light on the inside of the case between the AirPods. It will turn solid green when the charging is complete.

steps.title: Plug in a Qi-certified charging mat.
steps.content: Plug in a Qi-certified charging mat. You can wirelessly charge your MagSafe Charging Case or Wireless Charging Case with a compatible mat. [4] X Research source You can purchase compatible charging mats on the Apple website .

steps.title: Place your case on the charging mat.
steps.content: Place your case on the charging mat. Make sure the lid is closed and the status light is facing up. [5] X Research source For AirPods Pro (1st and 2nd generation) or AirPods (3rd generation), tap the case on the charging mat to see its charge level. If it's still charging, the light will be amber. If it's fully charged, the light will be green.

steps.title: Wake a synced device.
steps.content: Wake a synced device. This can be a paired iPhone or iPad. The device doesn't need to be unlocked, but it does need to be on. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Open your case lid.
steps.content: Open your case lid. This may take a few seconds. [7] X Research source A pop-up should open on your synced device with your battery levels for the case and the AirPods separately. Once the case is charged, you can use it to charge the AirPods .
